meanings.definition: The state of being unable to pay debts.
meanings.sent1: After losing his job, John faced insolvency and struggled to pay his bills.
meanings.sent2: The company declared insolvency when it could no longer cover its debts.
meanings.sent3: The insolvency of the piggy bank was evident when it refused to give up any more coins.
meanings.sent4: Her insolvency was like a leaky boat, slowly sinking under the weight of unpaid bills.
meanings.sent5: Insolvency loomed over him like a dark cloud, casting a shadow on his financial future.

meanings.definition: The condition of having liabilities exceeding assets.
meanings.sent1: The business faced insolvency due to its mounting debts surpassing its assets.
meanings.sent2: His personal insolvency became apparent when he realized he owed more than he owned.
meanings.sent3: The insolvency of the refrigerator was comical as it held only expired food.
meanings.sent4: Her insolvency felt like a heavy weight on her shoulders, dragging her down financially.
meanings.sent5: Insolvency was a ticking time bomb, waiting to explode the fragile balance of his finances.
